title: Ticket #2594: Negative process ages on mac
description:
On the mac machines in the batlab (both old and new), we occasionally see errors like this: 
ProcAPI sanity failure on pid 1317, age = -1901480712

This error is printed by ProcAPI::do_usage_sampling(), which is called by ProcAPI::getProcInfo(). The likely problem is that the sysctl() calls made by getProcInfoRaw() don't fail if the given pid doesn't exist. They return success and leave the structures meant to contain the process info untouched. getProcInfo() and getProcInfoRaw() then read values out of these uninitialized structures.

ProcAPI::getProcInfo() could be called repeatedly with a non-existent pid by KillFamily::takesnapshot(), which remembers pids it saw in the past and checks if they're still alive.

getProcInfo()/getProcInfoRaw() need to be modified on Darwin to properly detect when a pid doesn't exist. It appears we can detect this by checking whether the second call to sysctl() sets bufSize to 0 or non-0.
